Yes, The Criterion Collection is not just a collection of films, but a curator of cinema history. By restoring and preserving many classic and landmark films, and by providing context and special features that enhance our understanding and appreciation of them, The Criterion Collection has become an invaluable resource for cinephiles, film students, and anyone who loves film.

Many of the films that The Criterion Collection has popularized were initially overlooked or even ignored by mainstream audiences, but thanks to their efforts, these films have found a new audience and have been recognized as important works of art. The influence of these films can be seen in countless other movies and in the broader culture, as they have helped to shape our understanding of cinema and its place in the world.

Without The Criterion Collection, many of these films might have been lost or forgotten, and the cultural landscape of cinema would be much poorer for it. Their efforts to preserve and celebrate the history of cinema have been truly profound, and their impact on the world of film cannot be overstated.
